title: Great Practice
body: i have been with this practice for some time and i find the staff there are very helpful (with a few exceptions) and now during this crisis the uk is facing there have gone above and beyond to treat patients with the best they can. i called to order script and they young man there did nothing but help me get them via the different ways the NHS offer. the doctors must be proud of them and there calm at this time. keep up the good work

title: Calm and reassuring
body: Wanted to leave a review for my experience calling 111 today to discuss cv symptoms call answered in 10 minutes which I expected to be longer due to current circumstances, incredibly patient and professional call handler received a call from clinician 20 mins later again what an truly amazing service thank you for your kindness and support.

title: So grateful for efficient help
body: Phoned to sort-out my elderly parents prescriptions during the Coronavirus lockdown. Fantastic receptionist sorted-everything quickly, supremely efficiently and with kindness. SO grateful.

author: halfmanxc
title: Quick acting in Radiology
body:
Quick acting to call me in after needing to do ct scan after a xray the day before. Scan over in 5 mins.  
Thanks to all involved. Keep up the good work.  
[https://youtu.be/N5SDJBdoRNI?t=88](https://youtu.be/N5SDJBdoRNI)  
support for yourselves  
Hope you like it......

title: unhappy
body: went to see doctor few weeks ago concerning my depression he was very rude I felt worse than before I spoke to him also I am supposed to have a hba test every 6 mths that was not followed the only good thing about the surgery they have taken on new receptionists who are so friendly really think doctor improves his care I have moved surgeries they are great

title: Brilliant
body: I filled in an online consultation for my son‚Äôs eczema as the practise had closed for the evening. The next morning only 45 minutes into opening they called me and they‚Äôd sent a prescription through to our local pharmacy. Absolutely amazing even with Coronavirus going on they've done this so quickly. Thanks so much for your help!

title: Amazing practice
body: I couldn‚Äôt get my tooth extracted through my normal dentist due to the current situation I called 111 was sent to the dental hospital and they removed it straight away Thankyou so much no more painkillers for me üòä

author: AM2020
title: Being well cared for
body: I had an mental health episode and was brought to Stanage Ward. This was not my first episode though first time on this ward. From the start I found the care and operation of all personnel on the ward to be exceptionally kind. I can honestly say that I don‚Äôt have a single bad thing to describe about my two weeks on the ward. Everyone was gentle and careful not just with me but with everyone else on the ward

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust
Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

title: So far so good
body: I registered here a few months ago. So far I have had 2 GP appointments, a smear and an emergency telephone triage call during the Covid19 pandemic. Each time I  was impressed by the professionalism of the clinical staff and the modern, spacious and clean surroundings. Well done and thank you.

title: Amazing Care and Concern
body: I was taken by ambulance to Barnet Hospital on Monday (12/4/2020) evening because my blood pressure had gone up suddenly to 199/117. I was seen immediately by both medical and nursing staff. The care I received was indescribable. I had scans of my heart and head carried out. My blood pressure was monitored throughout my stay in A&E Major Trauma Section. I had allocated Nurses who couldn‚Äôt do enough to keep me safe and assured. My A&E Doctor was incredible. Words cannot express my gratitude. My heartfelt thanks to all the staff including the ambulance crew. I would gladly pay more in taxes for our NHS. You are simply the bestüòòüòòüëçüèΩ

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Disappointing
body: I avoid going to the doctors as much as possible mainly because of the reception staff, they are very blunt, rude and have given myself and family members false information every time we‚Äôve called. My GP is amazing although rarely there. The call system is rubbish for people who can‚Äôt answer their phones while at work (me being one of these people). It would be nice for this to be recognised and changed as this has been my doctors surgery for my whole life and is just getting worse over the years.

title: Fantastic service!
body: From start to finish my experience with Barnsley General was excellent. The waiting times (bearing in mind the country had just gone into lockdown due to the corona virus) were minimal and all staff were absolutely wonderful. I was treated with the respect, care and attention expected for such a delicate matter and cannot thank everyone enough!

title: Wonderful as Ever!
body: No waiting in the A and E and as usual brilliant treatment in these hard times from all nurses, doctor and receptionist. Cannot thank them enough for their totally painless treatments (I am an arch wimp!) and great efficiency, but most of all their kindness and reassurance. I have always praised my treatment at this hospital, but even more  right now. I count myself extremely lucky to be able to attend this fantastic hospital!

author: Ayrshire123
title: Emergency Dentist
body:
Day 6 of pain (regular pain killers are now not working)  
Contacted NHS24 at 12.30pm due to ongoing toothache, they advised the nurse would call me back  
They called me back at 15:37pm and advised that they would would pass my details to the dental department.  
Call centre called 20 min later to advise that someone from the area dental department would be in contact I waited 4hrs and due to my continued pain I contacted 111 who kindly made further enquiries and contacted the dental department and established that the department was closed.  
I appreciate that the current situation is unique however I am disappointed that I was not informed or at the least given advice.

readBy.name: Office of Ken Macintosh, MSP for West of Scotland

author: Diann
title: My mum
body: My mum has been in and out of hospital and in recent months /weeks more frequently. I feel there has been a failing of the trust in that there has not been any social care available.... she's been in a few days/a week constantly without any care plan put in place for her discharge. There is no trust.

readBy.name: Office of Jackie Baillie, MSP for Dumbarton

author: MummaM
title: You have made my pregnancy and after birth so easy
body:
I would like to thank the Larch team for there care and dedication to there jobs! During a crisis they have been helpful, understanding and truly amazing, Thank you.  
One person who stood out to me is my Midwife Gillian, she is fantastic at her job, helped me with any questions or worries I had, she was warm and friendly, I felt I could tell her anything.  
Thank you to the whole team you have made my pregnancy and after birth so easy.  
Please take care and stay safe.  
Xox

title: Really great practice
body: I attended the Eye Casualty on the advice of my optician, as I had sustained a significant drop in my vision. The Western Eye Hospital was very helpful and thorough in the way they assessed me. After a short wait, I was then shown in to see a Consultant, who diagnosed the problem. They explained to me that it can be sorted with a short laser procedure, for which my GP could refer me to my local services. As at the current time, the Covid-19 measures mean that most planned surgery has been suspended, the doctor kindly said that, as they weren't too busy at the time of my review, they could perform the procedure for me then and there. This was extraordinarily kind, as otherwise, I could have ended up waiting for many months to have things sorted. The procedure was carried out and my vision was restored to its former level. I am extremely grateful for the extra mile that the doctor went to help me out, in these unprecedented times and putting my needs as a patient above regular procedure.

author: GGibson
title: Great Experience
body:
I was recently discharged from Ward 2A Crosshouse Hospital, and I had a fantastic experience, the staff were all person-centred and focussed on delivering excellent holistic care. I particularly noticed how attentive to patients the staff were, nothing was a trouble to anyone, and the SCN was very involved in patient care also, which was another nice touch. The ward had a nice environment and all health care professionals were joyful and seemed happy at work.  
An excellent ward with even better staff. I particularly remembered Kat, Janet, Lauren, Steven and Helen. Thanks from the bottom of my heart.  
Cheers Guys. ‚ù§Ô∏è

author: Sm24
title: Labour and delivery
body: I was admitted in to hospital I am 34 weeks with twins. And contractors and pain. I was worried about having no visiting but it seems to be the best thing I can sleep when I want to midwifes are fantastic they picked up mine and babies bags from reception. For me I really think the nhs midwifery should look at making the visiting more tight for everyone. Fathers and birthing partners allowed in but not 24 hours a day.

author: Chess master
title: I had had a cut to my left arm and went to A+E.
body:
I was very pleased with the service in light of the current situation with Covid 19. I was doing some DIY And slashed the top of arm near my wrist with a Stanley knife. The bleeding did not stop although I applied pressure to the wound and elevated it.  
My wife dropped me off at Stoke Mandeville Hospital and after 15 minutes, I was seen to by a nurse called Sue. She cleaned the wound, administer some stitches and gave me some pain killers too! She explained to me, everything that she was doing and what I can expect along the way. I sincerely did expect this level of service, bearing in mind the current situation. Two thumbs up for Stoke Mandeville Hospital and a professional and fantastic nurse called SUE!!!

author: Old Granny
title: Quinsy Throat
body:
Went to Dr Malik with a sore throat and he initially diagnosed tonsillitis and prescribed an antibiotic. ..Throat didn‚Äôt get any better and I was vomiting and couldn‚Äôt swallow or keep anything down.  
Three days later was Re-examined and Dr Malik spotted an abscess in my throat. Bottom line was that I had Quinsy Throat and had to be admitted to hospital on the mainland. The E. N. T Specialist at the Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Glasgow said ‚Äúthe G. P had done well in spotting the abscess‚Äù as it was quite far back in my throat and difficult to spot.  
Following treatment and an overnight at the hospital I felt miles better and was discharged the following day. Quinsy Throat is a serious condition and can be fatal if not treated. I‚Äôm very grateful to our GP...Dr Malik ..for spotting it and all of the wonderful staff at the hospital. Thank You xxxxx‚ù§Ô∏è

author: G rateful
title: All the wonderful midwives and staff
body: I was induced early due to liver cholestasis and was in for 4 nights. I just wanted to thank all the wonderful midwives and staff who looked after me and baby Shelby during my stay on the induction ward, labour ward and post natal ward. Miguel and Kay on the induction ward were so kind and caring they made the experience so much better for me. Sheena my midwife during labour really listened to me and did a fantastic job helping me. Thankyou all so much for your wonderful care.

title: Excellent Practice
body: My wife contacted the surgery this morning because I was experiencing symptoms I didn‚Äôt want to talk about or bother the surgery about due to Coronavirus . I got a lovely phone call from a doctor in the afternoon and she went through everything in fine detail. I‚Äôm now getting the help I really needed. Under the stress etc the NHS is under I thought this was excellent service.

title: Very helpful and sympathetic to my needs
body:
I had to contact the surgery last week, due to a flare up with an ongoing eye condition. Dr , called me back, listened to my worries and was able to arrange an emergency appointment at the eye clinic, she called me back to confirm the appointment, even called the pharmacy to ensure they had the medication I need.  She reassured me that I was right calling the surgery, and never at any point did she make me feel I was wasting NHS time, during the covid 19 crisis.
I had my hospital appointment today, and my worries were confirmed, the problem with my eye had returned and I'm now on 3 lots of eye drops and tablets. Which I need to now permanently take. Thank you for your help and understanding and saved my eye sight.
I have only been with Hollybrook surgery, for a year since moving to the area, on the few occasions I have had to use them, I have found all the staff very polite and very helpful.

author: Need Outpatient Help
title: StrokeRecovery
body:
Patient was rushed out of hospital due to Covid 19. Understandably so however this has left us with some issues  
I was led to believe the patient was more mobile. He is unfortunately not the case and requires 24hour care. I do not feel technically or mentally equipped to do this. 3care visits per day have been arranged, but this is not manageable. The care given is often poor and he requires more equipment/guidance on equipment.  
Whilst I understand the need to protect people, it feels impossible to discuss my situation with someone, to understand how this will work long term. I get passed between departments, outsource providers, and different public sector divisions, it seems because no one knows or wants to discuss/help.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Kerri1095
title: It‚Äôs the little touches that make such a difference
body:
I went to ward 8 to be induced and was immediately put at ease and the induction explained to me really well - this was important to me as I had to go alone due to current lockdown rules and was already a bit nervous. When my labour started to progress the midwife Lucy overnight in ward 8 couldn‚Äôt have been more helpful she was quick with getting me analgesia and ran me a bath to help - she was reassuring and calming when I started to get myself more worked up with the pain and managed to get me transferred to ward 7 quickly.  
In ward 7 my care was taken over by Katie from the oak team - I met Katie previously at parent craft classes and I cannot thank her enough for making my birth experience the best it could be. With my little boy being back to back my pain was very intense and it led me and baby to be distressed and needing an epidural - but Katie listened to me and took my pain seriously doing everything she could to get me analgesia quickly. She was hands on and spent time really getting to know me and my partner and keeping us up to date the full time. I honestly couldn‚Äôt have had the experience I had without her - she is truly amazing at her job and is a huge asset to the team!  
Everyone I met from the midwives to the domestics to the consultants to the anaesthetic team were amazing and friendly and worked hard to make sure I was comfortable and baby was safe. When I moved to ward 8 again the staff were lovely and helped make sure we were feeling comfortable during the time we had to spend without my partner. It was my birthday and they even arranged a birthday cake for me and sang happy birthday. It‚Äôs the little touches like that that make such a difference - I‚Äôm so thankful for the amazing team at FVRH including my own community midwife Fiona. My experience from beginning to end has been so good and I‚Äôm forever in debt for the care my son and I have been given: )

author: Fliss68
title: Injury to finger
body: I cut off the tip of my middle finger while using a mincer to make meat loaf. On arrival at A& E I was seen very quickly and all the staff were friendly and efficient, especially considering that they are dealing with at the moment. I was then taken up to ward 214 to wait until there was a theatre slot available.   Again all the staff, were lovely and couldn't do enough to make sure I had everything I needed,   and was comfortable. When my time came to get my finger stitched up I have to say I was a bit nervous but the Drs Bismark (? spelling) and Nishit explained what was going to happen and Fiona, the nurse was excellent at keeping me occupied while the procedure was happening, staying past her shift to keep me company. Thank you everyone xx

title: Great experience
body:
I gave birth on 7th February to my first baby and I had a great experience at Croydon University Hospital. I was given advice over the phone the previous night when the contractions started and then looked after throughout the night. I had a vaginal breach delivery which required
constant monitoring so I had a full team of nurses, midwifes and doctors looking after me. My husband and myself felt really well looked after. Thank you so much!

title: Amazing Service
body:
I don‚Äôt know what happened 12 to 24 months ago but it is as though the practice has been turbo charged. Old reviews show a score below the Magic 2.   Ignore that old data.  My experience over the past 2 years had convinced me that that it couldn't be trying harder to improve, marvellous service!
Then I had an accident which proved just how different things were, and they were getting better.  I had a bad injury and the treatment, speed, late working etc from a nurse practitioner can only be described with the iconic term ‚ÄúAngel‚Äù.   Please don‚Äôt only look at the old star/position ratings.
It really is worth looking at the more recent reviews and talking to your friends and neighbours who may have been recently.  This practice is not what it used to be, that 2.x will be a 5 in no time.

title: eye surgery (cataract)
body: this was my second visit since Christmas, and on both occasions the staff "front" office through the nursing staff to the surgeon  were all very helpful and caring and on the second visit 25-03-2020 last WEDNESDAY was quite an experience due to the Covid 19 virus lockdowns however the staff again coped with this situation very professionally,  the clinic is clean and run very proficiently, thank you

author: JTL
title: I couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better team
body: I was expecting my first child and due to coronavirus I was a bit uneasy with the restrictions they had in place due to your partner being with you, it was an emotional time and the unexpected of what I was about to go through but due to having a c-section my husband couldn‚Äôt be with me but the team I had looking after me through the whole delivery from Midwifes, Doctors and Surgeons I couldn‚Äôt of asked for a better team, I felt so safe and was well taken care of right through to recovery and when moved to ward 8 (17). I am very thankful for all they done with the safe arrival of my son and will forever be grateful for our NHS. So many names to mention but all in all what a marvellous team and to all mums to be your in very safe hands. Thank you all once again.

author: TR068
title: Emergency Department and Critical Care
body:
Amazing care and teams  
thank you

author: Kathleen8
title: Wonderful care of our mother
body:
Our 93 year old mother was admitted to the Katherine Monk Unit at Basildon hospital with pneumonia , she was confirmed to have Covid-19.  
Due to her poorly condition it was agreed for her to be kept comfortable.  
Shortly after she received the last rites which family were able to share through the kindness of staff caring for her via video link.  
The care and kindness we witnessed took our breath away and filled our hearts with joy.  
No one can thank the staff in our NHS enough, but we do appreciate all you do for our loved ones. We know our mother will not die alone and this eases our grief a little.  
Thank you with love from our very large family ‚ù§Ô∏è

readBy.name: Basildon and Thurrock University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing!
body: All the doctors took great care of me and my family! Lovely people üíñ I can‚Äôt name names but one doctor in particular was so incredible I can‚Äôt describe. Thank you so much NHS, you are doing an excellent job!

author: Mr McG
title: Community mental health
body:
I am writing here because the feedback part of the website specifically for carers doesn't work!  
My son is under North and west CMHT.  
I wish to point out that despite claiming to have implemented "Triangle of care", this is not my experience.  
From Livewell website;  
"_What are the standards? _  
_Carers and the essential role they play should be identified at first contact with services or as soon as possible thereafter. _  
_Staff should be aware of carers and trained to engage with carers more effectively. _  
_Policies and protocols should be in place to ensure confidentiality and improve information sharing with carers. _  
_Defined roles (Carer link workers), responsible for carers should be in place. _  
_Carers should be ‚Äúintroduced‚Äù to the service and provided with a range of information. _  
_A range of carer support services should be available to offer or signpost carers to_."  
"_Carers and the essential role they play should be identified at first contact with services or as soon as possible thereafter_. " - This hasn't happened!  
"_Staff should be aware of carers and trained to engage with carers more effectively. _  
_Policies and protocols should be in place to ensure confidentiality and improve information sharing with carers._" - I wouldn't know if staff have been trained to engage with carers more effectively , as staff have never contacted me!  
"_Defined roles (Carer link workers), responsible for carers should be in place_. " - As above!  
"_Carers should be ‚Äúintroduced‚Äù to the service and provided with a range of information. _  
_A range of carer support services should be available to offer or signpost carers to_." - Nope!  
Yes, my wife and I do have information which CMHT would find useful re the care of our son.

readBy.name: Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Emmrd63
title: Very efficient, very helpful
body: Mr Lerwell was very efficient. He was very helpful and he provided his report in a timely manner.

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

author: JenG
title: All of the staff were fantastic
body: I attended the A& E department at Aberdeen Royal Infirmary in the early hours of Wednesday. I was experiencing acute swelling in my throat and was struggling to swallow or talk. Despite the extra strain at this time from the COVID-19 pandemic all of the staff were fantastic and my care was exemplary. I would like to pass on my thanks and respect for the hard working team.

title: Great experience
body:
I would like to express my thanks to the staff at Area R of the Northampton Integrated Sexual Health Service. 

I had been experiencing pain related to my contraceptive IUD for a few days and called the clinic on Monday 30/03 for an urgent appointment. I was triaged quickly and the team immediately booked me in for an appointment on the Tuesday 31/03. The two staff members who took my appointment were absolutely fantastic ‚Äì friendly and approachable which made for a really comfortable environment, whilst providing loads of information and answering all of my questions without making me feel silly or trying to rush me out of the door. This was my first experience with Northampton hospital services since moving to the area and I am thoroughly impressed, especially given the extraordinary pressure that all staff are under in the current circumstances (COVID-19).

title: kindness
body: My son needed a new boot for his fractured foot, because of being isolated due to the coronavirus a staff nurse at Salisbury District Hospital kindly offered to drop at our home.  What an incredibly kind thing to do, many thanks

title: Amazing teamwork
body: The Team work is amazing  nicely managed absolute miracle workers life savers they did the impossible for my mother even the nurses and doctors did not know how she survived the 6 months in hospital with her multiple diagnosis i  have allways came to King Georges Hospital and have allways left positive thanks to the hard work all the staff and management do i will never forget what they did for me i will take it to my grave thank yous for all the hard work yous do stay proud and stay strong keep up the great work.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Nixinoo
title: Bluebell Team Midwives
body:
I want to say a massive thank you to Diane and Siham for all their support throughout my pregnancy, labour and post pregnancy care.  
I joined the bluebell team halfway through my pregnancy and Diane explained clearly our area was piloting a different way the midwives would be working. Diane was my named midwife and I would be seeing her for any of my appointments and hopefully my labour if she was on shift or on call when I go in, if not it could be her buddy.  
Diane was a massive support throughout my pregnancy any questions or queries I had were not a an issue and I could send her a message and she would always reply.  
As it came to my labour, my waters went very early in the morning so I gave Dr Grays ward 3 a call, where I got asked if I could pop in for a check up, the lady I saw was reassuring and went through everything explaining when to come back in as I wasn't yet in active labour. When I went back into ward 3 later that day, I knew that Diane was on call that evening and felt more at ease knowing she would be my support throughout my labour. I had a few complications and before I knew it, I was having to be transferred through to Aberdeen.  
Diane and Siham (student midwife) came with me in the ambulance which yet again put myself at ease knowing I would have them with me for support. As we got to Aberdeen they were both amazing and could not fault them especially as they were working together without any extra support from the Aberdeen midwife team. Anything I asked for eg, copious amounts of water jugs, heat packs etc was never an issue. Diane and Siham guided me through my labour and made sure everything was ok before they headed back to elgin at the end of their shift.  
My care after that was OK, not the best, I had a few different members of staff pop in and out, I had asked to use the bathroom and possibly an hour and a half or so later I was finally able to go after mentioning it a lot. No one had spoke to me about feeding my newborn baby and as a first time mum I didn't know when she would need to be fed etc. I didn't feel there was a lot of support once Diane and Siham had left until I got moved onto the ward where the midwives there seemed nice and helpful.  
I cannot fault the new community midwife service that is being piloted, as a first time mum I loved the fact I felt I knew my midwife and had a connection with her instead of seeing several different midwifes who can only go by my medical notes. It definitely lowered my anxiety levels.  
Another big thank you to Diane and Siham from Dr Grays, you were both amazing and we could not fault you! Would love to have you for my next pregnancy.

author: snowpr53
title: My dads visit to Station 4
body:
Dad was recently admitted to station 4. Its been a difficult week not being able to visit. But, I can honestly say that the staff looking after him have been nothing short of amazing. Amy, Nicola and Louise are a few of the names, a Male nurse too whose name I didnt catch, the ward clerkess for not getting annoyed at me phoning when they all have a job to do. Their communication has been excellent.  
Nurse Nicola had a bit of a job on her hands trying to persuade dad to stay for another 24hrs but she persevered knowing it was in his best interests, she could just as easily have taken the easy way out, thank you. Dad has been in station 4 many times and is known to the staff, each time is excellent but communication seemed more heightened and better this time. We, as a very small family truly cant thank you enough from the bottom of our hearts for the care, kindness, compassion and empathy shown at a time which is difficult enough without all else going on. We wish each an every one of you and your own families continued health.

readBy.name: Office of Joan McAlpine, MSP for South of Scotland

author: Thomas1978
title: Very unhappy
body: The care I got from the nursing staff was excellent but the A and E Consultant was useless and was no help what's so ever and because of this I'm going to get in touch with public health England about my experience as I may as well not of bothered coming in as I'm still no better and still in a lot of pain I'm that bad I don't now where to turn and what to do as no one seems to want to do any thing. Also no stronger pain relief was offered as the pain relief I have was not touching the pain and if nothing is done from public health England I‚Äôll take it even Further one very unhappy patient

author: scoreboardsk35
title: My hospital stay
body:
I was recently admitted to the Royal Cornwall Hospital (Treliske).  
As you can imagine I was very anxious about this due to the current situation.  
From the time the paramedics arrived and I was admitted onto the ward I was totally put at ease.  
All of the staff wore their PPE and changed after each patient and I never felt I was at risk of contracting Covid-19 at any time. I was taken in via a separate entrance from suspected cases and even the hospital appeared to be divided into two.  
This may not have been the case but this is what it appeared to be by me as a patient.  
Thank you and well done to everyone at the RCHT for all the measures put in place and more personally for your care and support of me.

title: Helpful service
body: First time I used an online consultation today, and although I was apprehensive and unsure how efficient or useful it would be, it actually was very effective and prompt. There was hardly any waiting for a response, whereas I was anticipating to have to wait for a while, so after getting a quick and informative online response from the doctor, I'm glad I chose this method of contacting the practice today instead of trying to make a phone call, which would've been my obvious choice. Feel more reassured about my health concerns now, thank you.

title: Brilliant Service
body: I have been registered with the practice for many years and I feel my care needs are met. The doctors always takes time to listen to my problems. I find the doctors and staff treat the patients with respect. They have a Saturday clinic which is suitable for me as I work full time. I would definitely recommend this surgery.

title: Urgent Treatment Centre
body:
I received excellent management, treatment and observation
of my health problem. I could not ask for better support.
The medical, nursing and administrative staff are real ambassadors 
to the NHS.

Thank you so much.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Bad communication
body: The Home looks after my mum very well. The Home greatly employs non British and difficult to understand nurses and carers. I tried to get info on my mum but had to pretend I understood the non British nurse/carer for fear of upsetting them. No one likes to repeat themselves many times over. They find it insulting. I found it frustrating as I was non the wiser about my mum and was unable to give my worried brother overseas a report he wanted on my mum's condition. Other than that the Home Clinic does a good job.  Keith

title: Fantastic practice always helpful.
body: Both doctors have always been fantastic with myself and always listen. Friends receptionist. Thank you

title: Brilliant service
body: Huge thank you to the Receptionist and Dr who helped with a medication problem. It was much appreciated as I know how busy you all are during the pandemic. The NHS Is a wonderful thing. Thank you Becontree medical Centre staff.

title: Excellent practice
body: I have attended this practice for ten years. I am extremely pleased with every aspect of the services offered. It is easy to book on line appointments including emergency appointments and I have never had to wait for an appropriate appointment to become available, including occasional double appointments for complex matters or when I have wanted to discuss more than one matter. I have found all reception staff to be extremely friendly, professional and helpful, both on the phone and face to face. They go out of their way to be accommodating and helpful. Medical staff are all fully aware of my medical history, and extremely skilled and knowledgeable and listen to concerns and explanations. I have found their advice to be sound at all times. They have arranged prompt referrals when appropriate. In one case, the result of a test was received in the practice, the GP phoned me at home, sent a prescription to the pharmacy in town and I was able to collect it all within two hours. On another occasion, after being told that I required a CT scan I received a phone call from the hospital two hours later booking me in for my scan the next morning. It would be hard to improve on this kind of service, which is typical of this practice. I am reminded of ongoing procedures such as submitting blood pressure readings and attending for 'flu jabs. The practice itself includes several other facilities which I have not used, is clean and well maintained and with adequate parking including disabled driver spaces. It is certainly the best practice I have attended and I have complete trust and faith in all the staff. Thank you.

title: Brilliant and fast service
body: Came in at 16.00 on 15th April with a suspected broken finger. Was out of the hospital by 17.15. 4 xrays, seen by the nurse twice and everything was so smooth. Can not thank everybody enough especially at this unpredictable time.

title: Outstanding Practice
body: Each time I have to contact this surgery either for my self or my mum everyone is wonderful. The receptionists, nurses and Drs are really caring and listen carefully to what their patients are saying. Nothing is too much trouble. I‚Äôd like to thank you all from the bottom of my heart for the care you have shown since we joined this practice just over a year ago. I would highly recommend this surgery to anyone. Brilliant.

title: Excellent Reception Service
body:
I needed to update some of my personal information today. I received a call back within only a few hours of sending a message, and the Receptionist was extremely helpful and courteous. This staff member went above and beyond to assist me, and everything was sorted in just a few minutes.
All of the Reception staff are always very helpful, and I always receive excellent care from my preferred Doctor. 
Many thanks as always, HGH.

title: Kind & Caring
body:
I have been a patient at this surgery for 17 years & have always been happy with all my encounters over the years.
The past 3 years have been particularly challenging for myself & whenever I have interaction with any of the Doctors or Staff I have had a very positive experience. The Practice Manager goes above & beyond with her care & kindness.
I am grateful for all the help given to me & I would like to say many thanks to you all.

title: Just fantastic
body: Spent 9 days in ICU and the care you receive is outstanding. Every member of staff were all lovely and extremely caring people. Professional and knowledgeable. Can not fault ICU in any way! Massive thankyou to all the staff who looked after me night and day. A credit to this hospital as the staff work as a team and pass information clearly to each other. The care and attention helped me massively in my recovery after having a planned resection operation. Massive thankyou to all the staff in ICU.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Outstanding care
body: I visited the Woodlands during the Covid-19 outbreak for an operation in the day care unit. The hospital was immaculately clean and tidy, as were the staff and I felt confident that the potential risk for transmission would be negligible. The care I received was outstanding and the operation went very smoothly. I could not have hoped for better treatment and care.  Many thanks to all of the staff at the hospital.

title: Colposcopy/Lletz procedure.
body: I worried myself sick about this procedure since the appointment was booked and it was all for nothing. I can‚Äôt praise the two nurses enough. They were absolutely amazing and can‚Äôt get over how good and helpful they were!!! I suffer from anxiety and because of the COVID19 I wasn‚Äôt allowed anyone with me which didn‚Äôt help but I understand this had to be the case. The procedure it‚Äôs self was no where near as bad as I imagined, that even includes the injection which was slightly sharp for a second but nothing like I imagined. Thanks for making this experience as comfortable as possible. You made me feel at ease and I appreciated this more than you know

author: ReviewJES
title: Foot Surgery
body: I cannot speak highly enough of the fantastic staff in the Podiatry Day Surgery Unit, from the initial contact with the Reception staff to seeing Podiatrists for assessments, and then being put at ease by the Nurses, the Surgeon and  team on the day of my big toe fusion operation, I'm certain that I  could not have been treat better anywhere.   Having attended today for a progress review I was once again impressed by the kindness and understanding of the all the staff.   A massive thank you to all involved.

author: Cozer
title: Fracture clinic and two visits.
body:
I went to the Rotherham hospital fracture clinic around Easter this year 2020, I had several views taken of my foot and ankle in x-ray. I am at vulnerable risk at the moment so wasn't keen on going to any hospital let alone out but needed because of of the pain I'm suffering.  
The x-rays had got back and been checked just as I had sat back down in the waiting waiting room, I was told the the x-rays were all good as there was not any breaks, I went home and had my leg elevated above my head all the rest of the day and the day after. The pain has been gradually increasing, it's been waking me up and it's been also preventing me from sleeping, this isn't good as I suffer with seizures due to FND.  
The following day I received a call off a doctor from the clinic, who asked how I was doing and about my leg, and then told me there was a small crack been seen on the x-ray. I said I was taking prescribed pain relief but that wasn't touching it. They rang me back soon after and had said another Dr had also looked and seen a small crack, if the pain became unbearable for or I struggled to walk or the swelling had increased to go back to a&e then the clinic.  
I went to the clinic today as I had been asked too, only to be told off a different Dr there is no crack and they can't do anything for me, there's damage and floating bone from a old injury five year ago.  
The fact is I've ended up going great risk the second time when they could just have told me on the phone, and ¬£40 in taxis, how can two doctors say and agree but yet just one disagrees and I suffer, it's not great I got offered a boot well it's no good to me, I have falls as it is with one of those helping me.

title: Wonderful staff
body: Receptionist staff are always considerate about your availability. Doctors and nurses are well-informed and keep all records up-to-date, making my care much easier.

title: Great advice
body: Doctors and receptionists have always given great advice and are always willing to help. I'm always directed to the right services.

title: Positive experiences
body: I've always had really positive experiences with the staff, who are friendly and polite. I always get appointments when I need them and doctors listen to everything I have to say.

title: Great team
body: Recently came in for routine drug monitoring bloods during the Covid-19 pandemic.  Just wanted to day a massive thank you and well done to all the staff still working hard to keep the place open and see those who need it. Everyone is always so friendly and helpful at the practice even under these circumstances you feel like there is a team effort.

title: Fantastic service
body: I went in to hospital and was treated absolutely fantastically, well looked after nothing was to much trouble. All this was whilst the Corona virus was up in arms. I was one of there first cases and thankfully never had it but was treated exactly the same as anyone else. My husband came with me and again nothing was to much trouble for them. The NHS get slated so much but I can honestly say they have been fantastic

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

title: Reception staff
body:
I had to make appointment to see 1of the doctors after seeing a specialist at Barts , the consultant found something else when he examined me and told me to make appointment to see a  my doctor  well I tried but the receptionist was not listening to what I was trying to explain to her and being very rude  ,and she refused to book me appointment,  I know they are very busy at the moment but life goes on , I have to wait to the doctors surgery opens to
 the public when this is I don't know unless it gets to painful, we'll thanks for nothing and thanks for not helping me when I needed it,

author: Scared lady
title: Contact during Corona
body: I have had no contact with one recovery bucks for the past three weeks, while in lockdown. I know services were stopped but I did at least expect a phone call. My urges are at their worst right now, I'm alone, vulnerable and trying not to phone my dealer every hour of every day. I'm scared I'm going to cave in and relapse.

author: Buddy2013
title: Cannabis
body: Because of everything that‚Äôs going on with things being cancelled I have gone back to smoking cannabis.

author: Really happy
title: Care and treatment at radiotherapy department
body:
A very professional kind and caring group of individuals who provide a fantastic level of care.  
Premises spotless. People on reception very friendly and informative. Radiotherapy staff fantastic. Answers given to all questions asked. Professional caring approach from each and every employee. These people were fantastic. I can not fault anything in the time I had therapy in the area. People in treatment room F have been my heroes. They have treated me with dignity never rushing me. Always making me feel welcome.

readBy.name: Elaine Smith's office, MSP for Central Scotland

author: MRCAR
title: Pregnancy & labour
body:
When the day came to do my 8weeks booking in check, I couldn't of been more nervous. My sister-in-law had told me what to expect. However I then met Stephanie, and what a relief, she explained all about the blue team and the best start programme,  
how it had all changed, and she was going to be the ONE midwife I would see through the whole pregnancy. I instantly became relaxed, Stephanie was so nice and was so open to what my needs and wants were, even if didn't know at the time. The whole pregnancy I had questions that she answered with no problem. I then discovered I had gestational diabetes, which threw a spanner in the works, but, Stephanie being Stephanie fought hard for us as we wanted as natural a birth as possible, in the CMU. Fast forward to the end of January and we had a big baby, with a tiring mum. So in the end we opted to be induced, I thought it would be plain sailing, it wasn't.  
My partner and I were in the hospital for three and a half days before we were taken to the labour suite. We both understood that there is a priority list, but it felt that we were being forgotten about. I kicked up, and asked for a section on the third day, to then be put off as 'baby and mum are doing fine'.  
We were taken to the labour ward early hours of Saturday, I was hooked up to the drip and laboured for about 14hours and then I was told I was going for an emergency section, we weren't sure why, and still to this day don't, our daughter arrived shortly after that. We spent 5days in hospital, as there was a slight infection marker that was high. It's all a bit of a blur, but all the midwifes were fantastic with us, putting my partner at ease as it all happened to fast.All in all I can't fault Stephanie, our midwife from the start (and someone I would hope to have as my midwife again). All the lovely midwife's we met between arriving and leaving including, Kelly, Lauren, Claire and all the midwifes up in the wards. The CMU and the best start programme is something to be envious of, it gives continuity, which builds trust, and trust keeps people relaxed, and focused on the then and now, rather than trying to remember what was said last time, I can't fault it, and I hope that it stays with a possibility to be taken up by different health boards across Scotland.

readBy.name: Office of Ken Macintosh, MSP for West of Scotland
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: RedRaw
title: Finally having the correct medication
body:
I have had Bi-Polar for 19 years and thanks to NHS for eventually finding the medication that agrees with me.  
I have had my rollercoaster I have been sectioned 7 times the longest stretch I spent in hospital was 9 months since they got the correct medication I have not been sectioned for 12 years thank goodness.  
Because the Government are cutting benefits and trying to save money,  
I have been discharged from psychiatry however I am still a vulnerable disabled adult and services are discharging a lot of vulnerable adults because the government has instructed the NHS to do so.  
Its a scary world and with little support its terrifying, I feel it wont be long before I completely slip through the net.  
Its now about survival.  
[Happy with 'Finding your way']

author: Tasha208
title: Birth in MLU
body:
I gave birth to my second baby in Peterhead community hospital, a stand-alone Midwife Led Unit, during COVID19. My first birth, two years previously was in a large London hospital (natural birth, fast labour, 3rd degree tear).  
I had a very positive experience giving birth in Peterhead, the midwives who assisted us were very experienced, professional and kind, and the facilities were incredible. We had a private room with birthing pool throughout, and one midwife who stayed with us through the whole labour, and a second midwife who joined for the pushing stage / delivery. From the start I felt very confident in the support I was getting from the midwife, who really listened to my preferences for my birth plan, and helped me to stay calm throughout. She managed to give me both the space to move at my own speed and do what felt instinctive, and also clear direction and guidance when I needed it, particularly in the final pushing stage.  
I can‚Äôt say enough how grateful I am for the experience we had and the midwives who supported us, I wouldn‚Äôt change a thing about it.

author: ACelia
title: Feeling neglected when I get so much support from medical staff
body:
I am on Stelera medication. To find that my appointment for my due treatment had been deleted.  
Currently having a flare up because of an ibd nurse. Waiting for medication that cannot be stopped - booked by head of ibd. Prior to the nurse deleted my appointment date details. I‚Äôm a patient suffering from a bowel obstruction.  
My feedback, where is the urgent care for an IBD patient. Nurse needs to take more care. I usually give my honest and happy feedback being under the best medical care.

author: Maggie39
title: Excellent care
body:
Last year my husband was in and out the hospital with a mysterious pain and sickness , Nothing was showing up on scans etc ,the surgeon along with Dr.Dasari decided to operate , they found out that hubby had a twisted bowel and a recurring Lymphoma. His treatment from start to discharge was first class on wards 7 & 9 ,He then attended Borders Mac Millan centre and again first class care .  
Not long after his discharge I was admitted to A&E with heart problems again the care was first class and nothing was too much trouble for all the staff in Ward 5. Excellent hospital.

author: cassiopeiagw46
title: Amazing staff
body: Just want to thank all the staff on the stroke ward in particular the 3 nurses, Sandra, Joanne and Cameron. I had a TIA and received 5 star treatment on this ward. I felt that the amount of care checks they did was amazing, it felt like I received a full medical MOT. The care was exceptional and I felt that I was in a really safe place, so safe I didn‚Äôt want to leave. I was looked after so well all the staff are amazing.

title: Excellent outpatients‚Äô infusion appointment
body:
Thank you to the Matron of Polegate Ward and my Rheumatology Specialist Nurse for facilitating a repeat infusion for Rheumatoid Arthritis. And to the Infusion Unit Charge Nurse and team for running such a tight ship today,  in difficult circumstances, while continuing to be professional and caring, in the current pandemic.  This Ward is always like a new pin.
    While we are being encouraged to self - isolate/ social- distance, it is also worth bearing in mind that we should continue to attend outpatient appointments for the sake of our own health. ( if sometimes with a little persuasion from this caring team ).

author: Marylou92
title: Childrens Services Support Mansfield
body:
A year ago I was a complete shell with nobody to turn to and kept my thoughts and feelings to myself, after all, I was the one that had children so surely as their mum I was responsible solely for their health and wellbeing. Being a mum is the hardest things I've ever done, but definitely the most rewarding.  
7 years ago I suffered multiple miscarriages and 2 ectopic pregnancies resulting in only having one fallopian tube. To myself and my husbands surprise we went on to have 3 children, two boys and a beautiful girl! .  
I felt guilty for not knowing how to manage my 3 children aged 4 and under and then I met Kath. Kath is a support worker (or as I like to call her, god in a dress) It was obvious when I first met Kath she wanted to help and completed a family star with me and it was only then that I fully understood how much id been struggling. My husband is a work away lorry driver and my boys have additional needs.  
Kath first suggested the programme and I was sceptical, id already done a 123 magic course and felt that it had failed (probably because I thought we were a lost cause and nothing would change, I just thought my children were naughty and out of control). Kath suggested the Solihull approach and once again I nodded my head and thought, just complete the course and then you can go back to solitary and ignore everybody, little did I know without realising Kath was becoming my go to person, emotionally and physically she brought me back to life.  
I was at my lowest and at my wits end trying to spin all of these plates knowing one of the boys had autistic tendencies and the other ADHD. Two very very different individuals with a number of things that worked and didn't work for them personally.  
Every week Kath contacted me, spoke with me, guided me and ever so slowly put me in touch with people that could help me. I trusted her and as Kath said "give it a try what else have you got to lose by trying a different technique", she did it. I was put in touch with every single solitary person that could help myself and my family.  
Months on I now have the understanding, patience, knowledge and confidence to ensure my children have a solid routine that I am in control of not the other way around. I used to brand my children, and often say "no im not trying that because one understands but the other doesn't" when actually the programme taught me that if I didn't try how do I know? I now treat the children equally within family circumstances and give them the same boundaries and praise, whilst remembering they are still individuals.  
Kath was the one person in a thousand that I trust with my life. She never rushed me she let me cry, she told me every single day how amazing I was doing. She encouraged me when I saw her on courses I attended and most important she LISTENED. sometimes Kath didn't have the answers, but I can guarantee within 24 hours id have a phone call with a solution. She never forgot me, she always made me feel like we were the only family on her case load and always answered the phone.  
My marriage, mental health, children's health and happiness are right up back to where we were 3 years ago. I know not everyday will be perfect, and some days I will still want to cry or feel exhausted, but as kath taught me "if you're exhausted, that means you're doing your absolute best, well done you". Thank you to Kath, the only person who managed to drag me out of my hole, and not just for the current time but going forward. The children's centre have changed our whole family dynamic for the better and for that I'm forever grateful.

author: C4ris
title: Given the current climate the staff were fantastic
body: Whilst out running this morning I felt a pop in my knee. Instantly followed by a crack at the top of my shin. The pain was horrendous. I had no choice but to visit wishaw generals emergency department. All I can say is......Wow. Given the current climate the staff were fantastic. From the reception staff to the porters to radiology to the nurses and doctors and domestic staff. I'll even include the physio. Grudgingly though. Cause she cause me more pain. I'm kidding, they were all great. NHS staff take a bow. Turns out I done my front anterior cruciate ligament. Now on crutches and not happy. But the codeine should help üòÅ

readBy.name: Elaine Smith's office, MSP for Central Scotland

author: luckyone1
title: My mental health
body:
I felt so confused with my life. I couldn‚Äôt make decisions, I had no focus, my thoughts and worries were so irrational I actually felt like I was making myself so ill. I wanted to be able to feel confident again. I would look and admire other people for having such strength whilst I sat at home slowly dying inside. I suffered a major meltdown and blacked out, that‚Äôs when I made the decision to contact inclusion and it was the best decision I‚Äôve ever made.  
After being in therapy for 7-8 months I‚Äôm now the person I aspired to be. I could not have got here without the help of the whole team and my fantastic therapist. I‚Äôve been there in rock bottom when you feel there is no way out, you feel as if you will never feel ‚Äònormal‚Äô again, but you will. Please do not suffer, reach out and get help it will be hard, you will leave sessions feeling worse than when you went in! But you will recover, and when you do it will be the best feeling ever! Good luck

title: Wonderful village surgery
body: With everything going on at the moment with covid 19 I was still able to have a phone consultation with a Doctor just 8 minutes before the surgery was about to close. The receptionist and Doctor could not have been more helpful.  We are so lucky to have this wonderful surgery in our village and am truly grateful to everyone working there during these very difficult times.

author: rosieberry
title: Poor discharge planning from hospital to residential care
body:
I acknowledge the very difficult times that country is in, and the NHS but am writing here on behalf of my mum as I feel it is important to raise my concerns about the recent experience we have just had.  
Mum was recently in WD 8 James Cook University Hospital for 4 days, where she was admitted with a bad urine infection, resulting in delirium, immobility and a catheter. She was also diagnosed as covid 19 +ve on admission, but seemingly asymptomatic regarding this. Up until the point of admission mum was mobile with a rollator and not confused.  
Throughout the stay it was incredibly difficult to find out what was happening, but on several occasions was advised that she has a very bad pressure sore on her L heel ( Grade 4) that needed review by the tissue viability team on the Tuesday.  
Overnight on the Sunday, there appeared to be a change in plan and on contacting the ward mid afternoon on the Monday was advised that mum was going back to the care home. On asking if the home had the correct equipment to support mum was advised yes they did. On calling the home shortly afterwards and speaking with duty manager, was advised that they had not been told about the change in mums care needs, no mention of catheter, immobility or pressure sore. The manager rang the ward and when eventually they got through, mum had already left, and the person who answered said we don't discuss patients who are discharged and put the phone down.  
The manager and I discussed our various concerns regarding the situation, they call the District Nurse team, who visited the next day to make a full assessment, advising the discharge letter did not contain any of the above detail regarding mum's care needs or details of pressure sores, catheter or state of mobility.  
The situation seems very lacking. As a family member i was not advised on the change in plans, and feel the information provided to the care home was totally inadequate, and placing them in a very difficult position. Most of all it seems very unfair to my mum to have been on the receiving end. An irony made worse by the fact that she worked for the NHS for 40 years as nurse herself.

title: Professionalism in time of crisis
body:
Our NHS are brilliant. Despite having to respond to the Covid19 situation, many are still working as usual, under greater personal risk, diagnosing and treating people for other illnesses day in day out. I was fortunate to benefit from this first hand today as I underwent a gynaecological procedure at BDGH. The docs were thorough, the nurses caring and professional, the radiographers were focussed and compassionate, the receptionist were helpful, the cleaners were rigorous, the administrators were efficient.
Most of all, everyone was kind. It was an odd feeling to walk through the hospital with everyone in mask and gloves. We take for granted being able to see people's faces, smiles. The nurse who greeted me, as I was alone, immediately put me at ease. I now await results from a biopsy but know that when the results come through, whatever they are, I will have the support of BDGH and our NHS to help.
The workers of the NHS do this day in, day out. They are always there. We should protect this at all cost and thank them more than we do. Thankyou

title: Lack of communication
body:
I have booked for an Asthma review at 8pm today. There were conflicting text messages sent to me one which said not to come due to Covid-19 and the other messages asking me to turn up.  Since my recent few messages were reminding me to turn up, I went there only to find that no doctors/nurses available and that I would be getting a call to sort this out. There were no clear timings conveyed when this call would be so I could to take time off in between work.  

When times like this, you would expect the hospital would have clear communication in place so not to get the vulnerable patients out of their house but sadly it is not the case.Now I'm left with wondering what would happen next and how I would get my Asthma inhalers sorted out.

readBy.name: Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018

title: Fantastic service
body: Had to take my 8year old on Mon 30 March with a suspected broken arm. We were extremely anxious about going with the current covid-19 situation but the service we received was brilliant from start to finish both our temperatures checked before entering the building. We're taken into doctor within 2mins of being in the waiting room he was brilliant with my daughter quick examination and sent straight round to xray which was also very quick and confirmed a broken arm back to the doctor who put her in a splint instead of going to qa for a cast. In and out within 45mins. Absolutely amazing service during these current worrying times and didn't feel at all at risk. Keep up the amazing work guys you're doing a fantastic job

title: PPE and Social Distancing
body:
I accompanied my mother to a drive through blood test at St Lukes Oncology Department.
The provision of a drive through facility was both creative and reassuring.
However the lovely staff who dealt with us had no PPE equipment, bar a small bottle of Hand Sanitizer.
The nurse was within 30cm on my Mother. The risk this posed to my Mother, who has Leukaemia and your staff member was terrifying.
I also watched 3 groups of two staff members walking from one building to the other, shoulder to shoulder and a receptionist at the back entrance who showed absolutely no awareness of the need to keep a distance.
This leaves the question as to the safety of my Mother receiving treatment on site, during this epidemic.
I doubt you can solve the provision of masks but surely staff could be asked to keep 2m apart wherever possible.

title: Amazing staff great care!
body: I came in for an MRI scan last week and I wanted to say a massive thank you to the imaging department for their care. It was the receptionists birthday and despite being very busy and in the current circumstances with COVID she was extremely friendly and reassuring. The work and care from everyone in this hospital is amazing and we are so grateful to everyone, for their hard work. I cannot thank you all enough!

title: Prompt attention
body: I need to have a repeat blood test at the Surgery. In the present circumstances with Covid 19, expected to have to wait for some time. However, I was able to make an appointment in a timely fashion. The GP was very helpful too with the phone consultation.

title: Grateful
body: My scan was arranged 2 weeks ago and due to take place at the end of March. With everything that's going on around Coronavirus I assumed my scan would be cancelled. However I was delighted when I received a call to say despite the original location of where my scan was due to take place being closed. I was offered 3 alternative locations. On choosing a new location I was asked questions about my current health and was again contacted on the morning of my scan, making sure I had no Cornoavirus symptoms and ensuring that I had not been in contact with anyone that did.  I was given clear instructions on the procedure for when I attended the surgery where my scan would now take place. They were very professional and made sure I was safe at all time. I attended my scan and was given my  results there and then. I am so grateful that my scan could still take place and i didn't have to wait for months and months as i anticipated.

title: Great Service
body: Due to Coronvirus, when my phoned rang and was told it was ScanAssure I thought my scan was cancelled. In fact they moved my scan sooner and explained that I would simply have to just change location, which i was more than happy to do, as i was desperate to have my  scan done. I was sent a text and phoned three times to go through procedures and to ask me questions about my current health, which pt m at ease. I thought i would be waiting for weeks possibly months but the fact my scan still went ahead was brilliant and even ore so that I was given my results there and then. Thanks

title: Top service & Top surgery in difficult times
body:
I have been to my doctors 4 times over the past 12 months and was eventually referred for a Ultrasound scan, due to take place in Rochdale on 31.3.20. I was phoned and told the surgery had closed and only open for urgent patients. I believed my scan was urgent and was gutted at the thought it would be cancelled and i would have to wait even longer. However I was offered 3 alternative locations and as long as i didnt mind travelling 20 mins the scan could go ahead 3 days later than initially planned. I was sent directions via a text with all the information on for the new location, which was just outside Manchester city center at the Arch Medical practice. I was phoned the day before and the morning of my scan to make sure i didnt have corona symptoms. I was massively impressed with the process and ensuring I was kept safe at all times, i was provided with hand sanitizer at the clinic and was able to wear my mask during my scan. All the staff at the surgery and the guy who did my scan were class and i got told there and then what was wrong and what would happen moving forwards. I know a lot of places are closed and people are scared in
this difficult times, but scans still need doing and as i have found out all hospitals have stopped doing scans at the present time so i am really happy I could still have mine done with ScanAssure.

title: Knee replacement
body: I had a total knee replacement here and was absolutely terrified.From the moment I arrived at ward 3 at 7am from Carlisle I was put at ease.The care I had was superb nothing was too much trouble everyone was lovely.The food was great even the op itself wasn't as bad as I imagined and I had a lovely single room.I will probably need my other knee done in the future and I would not hesitate to return to Hexham.Thank you all you are all stars

title: Great facility
body: Harold Wood is my local centre ad a great facility always been extremely satisfied with the service.

title: Thank you
body:
I have just had a telephone conversation with a member of your team. I knew you would be very busy and my request was not of an urgent matter (except to me!), but your colleague was polite, courteous, helpful and efficient in managing my repeat prescription at a time when I realise I should not enter the surgery.
So, thank you - not just for the above but for the way I am sure you are all helping people in Bar Hill at this time.

title: Amazing
body: Greystone staff have been absolutely amazing recently when I've needed help during the coronavirus pandemic. Although they must be under indescribable pressure, they remain patient, reassuring and responsive. Thank you.

title: Positive experience
body: I've had a great experience here. This surgery is dealing with this situation very well. The staff are very accommodating and are still offering a range of services including online consultations with clinicians

title: They have mended me.
body:
3 years ago I was diagnosed with prostate cancer. The urology department, with Weston Park have provided wonderful and successful treatment, and have discharged me from their care. With no exception, I have been treated with respect and caring treatment, the information and advice I have received has been crystal clear and prompt.
Eternal thanks to all for getting ME through this challenge. I didn't want it, but everybody should be proud that they (and the whole NHS) have made the experience as good as it has been possible to do so.
I'm now off to enjoy the rest of my life (subject to coronavirus issues)
THANK YOU!!

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great doctors
body: Had to go in for an emergency appointment today due to an infected wound. Lots of precautions taken due to the current situation with covid-19, and lots of unnecessary apologies for it. The whole team were calm and reassuring. Lovely surgery - always impressed. Thank you so much for everything you do!

title: Despite Covid-19, treated my father with‚Ä¶
body:
My dad is just being released from the hospital suffering from pneumonia from coronavirus infection. As family were not able to visit him and it was a very very difficult time. He is being released today and having spoken to him he has told me how kind, considerate and professional the staff were - which I understand must have been difficult with a condition in which not enough is yet known. 
You hospital staff are true heroes and I appreciate you and my family appreciates you. You have helped to nurse back my father and I am eternally grateful. 
Thank you for risking your own health for that of others and in light of everything, maintaining a sense of humour and clinical professionalism unrivalled anywhere in the world.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing caring service
body:
My in-laws are elderly with underlying health conditions and we have been amazed and very grateful for the support offered by this practice. 
There have been regular text messages with advice and offers of help including about Coronavirus and today I received a personal phone call from the doctor asking about arrangements for shielding and if they needed any help. He re-iterated that help was available and we should not hesitate to contact them. 
Amazing caring service and contrasts with the service my parents have received from a practice in Twickenham. 
Thank you!

title: Amazing Staff
body: My mam is currently in Redcar Hospital, she‚Äôs been in there a week and what the Dr and nurses have done for her me and my four sisters can‚Äôt thank them enough, she spent 2 weeks in James Cook Hospital before being transferred to Redcar. She has made great progress in such a short time while being at Redcar and hopefully should be home soon. So thank you so much. Much love x

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
